alert.note: Alert for Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:24AM CDT until June 01 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Carson, Potter and Randall. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of around 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amarillo and Pantex. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
